00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantPlier.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Oct 24 10:45:35 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing probe set quantification using the PLIER (Probe
00028  * Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method.
00029  */
00030 #ifndef _QUANTPLIER_H_
00031 #define _QUANTPLIER_H_
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "chipstream/QuantPlierBase.h"
00035 
00036 /// String description of quant plier chipstream.
00037 #define QUANTPLIERSTR "plier"
00038 
00039 /**
00040  *  Class for doing probe set quantification using the PLIER (Probe
00041  * Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method.
00042  */
00043 class QuantPlier : public QuantPlierBase {
00044 
00045 public:
00046 
00047   /** 
00048    * What version of the algorithm are we implementing?
00049    * @return version string.
00050    */
00051   std::string getVersion() {
00052     return "2.0";
00053   }
00054 
00055   /**
00056    * Constructor. 
00057    */
00058   QuantPlier(QuantPlierParams &plierParams);
00059 
00060   /**
00061    * Destructor.
00062    */
00063   virtual ~QuantPlier();
00064 
00065   /** 
00066    * @brief Do the heavy lifting of plier.
00067    */
00068   void computeEstimate();
00069 
00070   /** 
00071    * @brief Return number of features (probes).
00072    * @return feature count.
00073    */
00074   unsigned int getNumFeatures();
00075 
00076   /** 
00077    * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00078    * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00079    */
00080   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc);
00081 
00082 
00083   /** 
00084    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00085    * class performs and what parameters it takes.  The default
00086    * parameters are from the inputs.txt file in the sdk example.
00087    * @return SelfDoc
00088    */
00089   static SelfDoc explainSelf();
00090 
00091   /** 
00092    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00093    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00094    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00095    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00096    * The default values used for the plier parameters are from the
00097    * inputs.txt file in the sdk example.
00098    * 
00099    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00100    * 
00101    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00102    */
00103   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00104 
00105   /** 
00106    * @brief Specify precomputed feature effects to be used as map from
00107    * probe id index to the feature effect.  This make plier much
00108    * faster to do as doesn't have to iterate through anything, but
00109    * have to make sure that the feature effects being used match the
00110    * analysis that is being done. For example the feature effects
00111    * might be different using pm-only, pm-gcbg and pm-mm adjustments.
00112    * 
00113    * @param featureEffects - mapping from probe idex to feature effects.
00114    */
00115   void setFeaturePriorEffects(double* featureEffects, int iSize);
00116 
00117 private:
00118   /** 
00119    * @brief Allocate enough memory for at least maxChips and
00120    * maxProbes.
00121    * 
00122    * @param maxChips - Number of chips that can be computed.
00123    * @param maxProbes - Number of probes or features that can be computed.
00124    */
00125   void allocMemory(unsigned int maxChips, unsigned int maxProbes);
00126 
00127   /** 
00128    * @brief Free up all the memory that has bee allocated.
00129    */
00130   void freeMemory();
00131 
00132   /**
00133    * @brief Set memory variables to zero/null
00134    */
00135   void zeroMemoryVars();
00136  
00137 
00138 };
00139 
00140 #endif /* _QUANTPLIER_H_ */
